articles.description: The latest chapter in the burgeoning rivalry between Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz will play out in Grand Slam final for the first time in Sunday's French Open showpiece.
articles.title: French Open 2025: Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz meet in 'special' men's final

articles.description: Former Tottenham manager Mauricio Pochettino says a return to the club to replace Ange Postecoglou is "not realistic".
articles.title: Tottenham: Mauricio Pochettino rules himself out of running to replace Ange Postecoglou

articles.description: Thomas Tuchel criticises England's "attitude" and feels they "played with fire" in a narrow 1-0 World Cup qualifying win away to Andorra.
articles.title: England: Thomas Tuchel criticises his side's attitude in narrow Andorra win

articles.description: Scotland have called up free agent Ross Doohan and Bournemouth 18-year-old Callan McKenna after facing a goalkeeping crisis for Monday's friendly in Liechtenstein.
articles.title: Scotland call up Doohan and McKenna after goalkeeper SOS

articles.description: Accolades in sport are one thing, but the soon-to-retire Lizzie Deignan is now racing with the very people she inspired to get on a bike.
articles.title: Tour of Britain Women 2025: How Lizzie Deignan made cycling cool

articles.description: Cristiano Ronaldo (the best player in his 40s in the world) comes up against Lamine Yamal (the best teenager in the world) in Sunday's Nations League final. BBC Sport sees how they compare.
articles.title: Cristiano Ronaldo and Lamine Yamal set to meet as Portugal play Spain

articles.description: Coco Gauff has finally become the French Open champion, going from tears of pain to tears of joy in Paris. This is how she did it.
articles.title: French Open 2025: Coco Gauff goes from tears of pain to tears of joy at Roland Garros

articles.description: BBC Sport assesses the current state of play in the world of heavyweight boxing after Fabio Wardley's victory over Justis Huni.
articles.title: Boxing: Oleksandr Usyk, Daniel Dubois, Fabio Wardley - What next for heavyweight division?

articles.description: Manchester City are on the verge of completing a £31m deal to sign left-back Rayan Ait-Nouri from Wolves.
articles.title: Rayan Ait-Nouri: Manchester City on verge on completing £31m deal for Wolves left-back

articles.description: England have started the summer by thrashing a depleted West Indies side - but what does it mean for the team's post-Ashes rebuild and World Cup hopes?
articles.title: England women's cricket: Four talking points from Charlotte Edwards and Nat Sciver-Brunt's first series
